isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Injector Disable

svcproc.title: Injector Disable
svcproc.para: To determine the cause of rough engine idle

note.para: This test is used in conjunction with Test 19 (Relative Compression) to distinguish between an injector problem or a mechanical problem.

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

note.para: Before doing this test, make sure Tests 1-17 were completed and the following conditions are maintained:

step1.para: Open KOER IDT V8.ssn. to monitor engine operation.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Start engine.
Select Diagnostics from menu bar.
Select V8 Injector Disable Test.
Select Collect Data. (Base Line values will be shown.)
Record Base Line values, EOT, average fuel rate, and average engine load on Performance Diagnostic form.
Select Cylinder 1 and click Run. (Injector 1 will be disabled.)
Click Collect Data.
Record EOT, average fuel rate, and average engine load on diagnostics form.

note.para: While running the engine listen for sound variations from cylinder to cylinder.

step1.para: Repeat Steps 7 - 9 for each cylinder.
Subtract the base line for (average fuel rate) from the (average fuel rate) for each injector and record the difference (deviation).
Add deviations for all injectors and divide by 8. (Round to the nearest tenth - this is the cut off value.)
Record cut off value on diagnostics form.
Subtract the base line for (average engine load) from the (average engine load) for each injector and record the difference (deviation).
Add deviations for all injectors and divide by 8. (Round to the nearest tenth - this is the cut off value.)
Record cut off value on diagnostics form.

item.para: If deviation values for both average fuel rate and average engine load are less than the cut-off values for both fuel rate and engine load, the injector is suspect for weak cylinder contribution.
If only one deviation value is less than a cut-off value, do not suspect that cylinder.
If a suspect cylinder(s) is identified, do Test 19 (Relative Compression) to distinguish between an injector or mechanical problem.
If test 19 (Relative Compression) shows that cylinders are mechanically sound but the Injector Disable Test shows that one or more cylinders are bad, continue with Step 15.

step1.para: Remove valve cover for suspect cylinder(s).
Start engine and run at idle.
Check oil coming out of spill spout of suspected injector(s). (Less oil coming out, compared with more oil coming out of the other injectors, means that less fuel is being delivered to the cylinder.)

item.para: If less oil is coming out of suspected injector(s), it is further confirmation of a bad injector.

step1.para: Replace injector(s) following procedures in the Engine Service Manual and retest.
Test drive vehicle for 20 miles and check for rough idle.
If rough idle continues, do the Injector Disable Test again.
